t: John 12
The Anointing at Bethany
Then,*p six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus was who had been dead, whom He had raised from the dead.
There they made Him a supper; and Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those who sat at the table with Him.
Then Mary took a pound of very costly oil of spikenard, anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped His feet with her hair. And the house was filled with the fragrance of the oil.
But*p one of His disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son,*i who would betray Him, said,
“Why was this fragrant oil not sold for three hundred denarii and given to the poor?”
This he said, not that he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief, and had the money box; and he used to take what was put in it.
But*p Jesus said, “Let*r her*r alone;*r she*r has*r kept*r this*r for*r the*r day*r of*r My*r burial.*r
For*r the*r poor*r you*r have*r with*r you*r always,*r but*r Me*r you*r do*r not*r have*r always.”*r
The Plot to Kill Lazarus
Now*p a great many of the Jews knew that He was there; and they came, not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might also see Lazarus, whom He had raised from the dead.
But the chief priests plotted to put Lazarus to death also,
because on account of him many of the Jews went away and believed in Jesus.
The Triumphal Entry
The*p next day a great multitude that had come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
took branches of palm trees and went out to meet Him, and cried out: “Hosanna!*pn ‘Blessed*ld is*i He who comes in the name of the Lord!’*sb The*ld King of Israel!”
Then*p Jesus, when He had found a young donkey, sat on it; as it is written:
“Fear*pn not, daughter of Zion; Behold,*ld your King is coming, Sitting*ld on a donkey’s colt.”
His*p disciples did not understand these things at first; but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written about Him and that*i they had done these things to Him.
Therefore*p the people, who were with Him when He called Lazarus out of his tomb and raised him from the dead, bore witness.
For this reason the people also met Him, because they heard that He had done this sign.
The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, “You see that you are accomplishing nothing. Look, the world has gone after Him!”
The Fruitful Grain of Wheat
Now*p there were certain Greeks among those who came up to worship at the feast.
Then they came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida of Galilee, and asked him, saying, “Sir, we wish to see Jesus.”
Philip*p came and told Andrew, and in turn Andrew and Philip told Jesus.
But*p Jesus answered them, saying, “The*r hour*r has*r come*r that*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r should*r be*r glorified.*r
Most*r assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r unless*r a*r grain*r of*r wheat*r falls*r into*r the*r ground*r and*r dies,*r it*r remains*r alone;*r but*r if*r it*r dies,*r it*r produces*r much*r grain.*r
He*r who*r loves*r his*r life*r will*r lose*r it,*r and*r he*r who*r hates*r his*r life*r in*r this*r world*r will*r keep*r it*r for*r eternal*r life.*r
If*r anyone*r serves*r Me,*r let*r him*r follow*r Me;*r and*r where*r I*r am,*r there*r My*r servant*r will*r be*r also.*r If*r anyone*r serves*r Me,*r him*r My*ir Father*r will*r honor.*r
Jesus Predicts His Death on the Cross
“Now*rp My*r soul*r is*r troubled,*r and*r what*r shall*r I*r say?*r ‘Father,*r save*r Me*r from*r this*r hour’?*r But*r for*r this*r purpose*r I*r came*r to*r this*r hour.*r
Father,*r glorify*r Your*r name.”*r Then*p a voice came from heaven, saying,*i “I have both glorified it*i and will glorify it*i again.”
Therefore*p the people who stood by and heard it*i said that it had thundered. Others said, “An angel has spoken to Him.”
Jesus*p answered and said, “This*r voice*r did*r not*r come*r because*r of*r Me,*r but*r for*r your*r sake.*r
Now*r is*r the*r judgment*r of*r this*r world;*r now*r the*r ruler*r of*r this*r world*r will*r be*r cast*r out.*r
And*r I,*r if*r I*r am*r lifted*r up*r from*r the*r earth,*r will*r draw*r all*r peoples*ir to*r Myself.”*r
This He said, signifying by what death He would die.
The*p people answered Him, “We have heard from the law that the Christ remains forever; and how can*i You say, ‘The*r Son*r of*r Man*r must*r be*r lifted*r up’?*r Who is this Son of Man?”

Then*p Jesus said to them, “A*r little*r while*r longer*r the*r light*r is*r with*r you.*r Walk*r while*r you*r have*r the*r light,*r lest*r darkness*r overtake*r you;*r he*r who*r walks*r in*r darkness*r does*r not*r know*r where*r he*r is*r going.*r
While*r you*r have*r the*r light,*r believe*r in*r the*r light,*r that*r you*r may*r become*r sons*r of*r light.”*r These things Jesus spoke, and departed, and was hidden from them.
Who Has Believed Our Report?
But*p although He had done so many signs before them, they did not believe in Him,
that the word of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spoke: “Lord,*pn who has believed our report? And*ld to whom has the arm of the Lord*sb been revealed?”
Therefore*p they could not believe, because Isaiah said again:
“He*pn has blinded their eyes and hardened their hearts, Lest*ld they should see with their*i eyes, Lest*ld they should understand with their*i hearts and turn, So*ld that I should heal them.”
These*p things Isaiah said when he saw His glory and spoke of Him.
Walk in the Light
Nevertheless*p even among the rulers many believed in Him, but because of the Pharisees they did not confess Him,*i lest they should be put out of the synagogue;
for they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.
Then*p Jesus cried out and said, “He*r who*r believes*r in*r Me,*r believes*r not*r in*r Me*r but*r in*r Him*r who*r sent*r Me.*r
And*r he*r who*r sees*r Me*r sees*r Him*r who*r sent*r Me.*r
I*r have*r come*r as*ir a*r light*r into*r the*r world,*r that*r whoever*r believes*r in*r Me*r should*r not*r abide*r in*r darkness.*r
And*r if*r anyone*r hears*r My*r words*r and*r does*r not*r believe,*r I*r do*r not*r judge*r him;*r for*r I*r did*r not*r come*r to*r judge*r the*r world*r but*r to*r save*r the*r world.*r
He*r who*r rejects*r Me,*r and*r does*r not*r receive*r My*r words,*r has*r that*r which*r judges*r him—*r the*r word*r that*r I*r have*r spoken*r will*r judge*r him*r in*r the*r last*r day.*r
For*r I*r have*r not*r spoken*r on*r My*r own*r authority;*ir but*r the*r Father*r who*r sent*r Me*r gave*r Me*r a*r command,*r what*r I*r should*r say*r and*r what*r I*r should*r speak.*r
And*r I*r know*r that*r His*r command*r is*r everlasting*r life.*r Therefore,*r whatever*r I*r speak,*r just*r as*r the*r Father*r has*r told*r Me,*r so*r I*r speak.”*r
